text: Niṭṭhitacīvarasmiṃ bhikkhuniyā ubbhatasmiṃ kathine ekarattampi ce bhikkhunī ticīvarena vippavaseyya aññatra bhikkhunisammutiyā nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ
edit: Niṭṭhitacīvarasmiṃ bhikkhuniyā ubbhatasmiṃ kathine ekarattampi ce bhikkhunī ticīvarena vippavaseyya aññatra bhikkhunisammutiyā nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ

translations.transtext: 14. When a bhikkhunī has finished her robe and the frame is destroyed (her kathina privileges are in abeyance): If she dwells apart from (any of) her five robes even for one night — unless authorized by the bhikkhunīs — it is to be forfeited and confessed.
